title: Fragment With Factory Stamp, ca. 1830
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: block printed on plain weave foundation. Block registration marks are visible. Blocks for ten different colors were used. Four bands of red weft (now faded) were woven into fabric at heading.
inscribed: "No 134 Oxford St. MILES & EDWARDS LONDON" with crown within frame in black. On either side of this mark is a block printed anthemion frieze in red. Printers' marks are; "TW" in yellow, and "TC" in blue. Handwritten in ink, "28yds".
dimensions: Warp: 39 cm (15 1/4in.). Weft: 65.5cm (25 3/4in.). Both selvedges present.
description: Factory mark at one end. Large scale pattern of polychrome baskets of flowers and ribbons.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fragment With Factory Stamp, ca. 1830.
ca. 1830. Medium: cotton
Technique: block printed on plain weave foundation. Block registration marks are visible. Blocks for ten different colors were used. Four bands of red weft (now faded) were woven into fabric at heading.. Bequest of Elinor Merrell. 1995-50-25.
